comments.body: Should we pin this @isuruf? If so can you suggest a pinning in https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-forge.github.io/blob/master/scripts/pin_the_slow_way.py

I'm new to pinning, so I've been following conda-forge's policies and that's it. As far as I know, anything compiled with gmp 5.0.0 should be okay, but if we want that, shouldn't we compile with the oldest, instead of the newest?

> As far as I know, anything compiled with gmp 5.0.0 should be okay, but if we want that, shouldn't we compile with the oldest, instead of the newest?

Not really. As long as we use the same pinning in all software in `conda-forge` and we coordinate with `defaults` we should be OK. I asked because I have no idea what versions of `gmp` are available out there.

It seems defaults has upgraded to 6.1.0 very recently and I think there are no packages using gmp on defaults. I think pinning to `gmp >= 5.0, < 7.0` should be okay for now.

See this, https://github.com/lvc/abi-reports/blob/master/report/gmp.json

Awesome! Do you want to send a PR to the pinning script with that suggestion?
There is no rush to do this BTW.
